college_profile.organization_type: Public 2-year community college; Native-serving, commuter campus
college_profile.size: Medium community college (~4,200 degree-seeking undergraduates; ~8,300 annual headcount)
college_profile.campus_setting: Suburban/rural edge of Farmington (4601 College Blvd)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $4,526 average net price for in-district students receiving aid (2022-23 Scorecard)
college_profile.median_earnings: $36,513 median earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: Roughly 90% of undergrads receive grant or scholarship aid
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: ~63% of full-time beginning students receive Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $6,253 median federal loan debt; about $103/month standard plan
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: About 23% of students use federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn about $36K at the median ten years after enrolling (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: Native-serving institution with large American Indian/Alaska Native population alongside Hispanic/Latine and White students; predominantly nontraditional and part-time.
college_profile.test_score: Open admission; placement via Accuplacer/Guided Self-Placement rather than ACT/SAT.
college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the commuter living allowance; typical student grocery budgets run $3,000-$3,500/year.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $3,724 personal/other expenses used in cost of attendance.
college_profile.crime_rate: Clery reports show low incident counts typical of a commuter campus (no residence halls).
college_profile.salary_range: $18K–$57K earnings range (25th–75th percentile 10 years after entry)
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most instructors hold master’s or terminal credentials; full-time faculty presence is strong across programs.
college_profile.rank: Board-of-Nursing aligned ADN with clinical placements across the Four Corners region.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Concept-based curriculum with integrated pharmacology, simulation, and clinical rotations.
college_profile.facilities: Simulation labs, skills labs, and health sciences classrooms on the Farmington campus.
college_profile.student_life: Cohort model, Student Nurses Association, NCLEX prep, and peer tutoring.

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn about $36K at the median ten years after enrolling (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: Native-serving institution with large American Indian/Alaska Native population alongside Hispanic/Latine and White students; predominantly nontraditional and part-time.
college_profile.test_score: Open admission; placement via Accuplacer/Guided Self-Placement rather than ACT/SAT.
college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the commuter living allowance; typical student grocery budgets run $3,000-$3,500/year.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $3,724 personal/other expenses used in cost of attendance.
college_profile.crime_rate: Clery reports show low incident counts typical of a commuter campus (no residence halls).

college_profile.rank: Transfer-ready CS/IT pathway aligned with UNM/NMSU lower-division outcomes.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Programming, data structures, discrete math, networking, and capstone for transfer or entry-level tech roles.
college_profile.facilities: Modern computing labs and virtual lab access for networking and systems courses.
college_profile.student_life: Coding club, hackathons, and regional internships with tech employers.

college_profile.test_score: Open admission; placement via Accuplacer/Guided Self-Placement rather than ACT/SAT.

college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most instructors hold master’s or terminal credentials; full-time faculty presence is strong across programs.
college_profile.rank: Workforce-focused AAS aligned with Security+/Network+ skills and Four Corners employer needs.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Hands-on labs in networking, Linux, scripting, ethical hacking, forensics, cloud security, and incident response with a capstone.
college_profile.facilities: Cyber labs with networking gear, virtualization, and remote access for commuters.
college_profile.student_life: Cyber club, capture-the-flag events, and internship pathways with local utilities, tribal entities, and state agencies.
